actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-215, by Mr. Reynolds.

Rule provides for consideration of. Upon adoption of this resolution it shall be in order, any rule of the House to the contrary notwithstanding, to consider a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day District Work Period.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 82.

official_title: Providing for consideration of a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day district work period.

summary.text: Makes it in order to consider a concurrent resolution providing for an adjournment of the House of Representatives and the Senate for the Independence Day district work period.

titles.title: Providing for consideration of a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day district work period.
